comments.author: tara
comments.content: Gorgeous. Simply gorgeous. Not only is the photograph a beautiful thing, but the recipe sounds even better. A Canadian of Indian descent, who is currently pregnant to boot, I have to say I have SUCH cravings for bhel puri and all those other savory sweet plates of crunchy goodness; that's the thing about chaats, they offer such wonderful contrasts!

comments.author: alpa
comments.content: When eating chaats in a cafe/bistro type restaurant you get used to getting them without any fanfare, so i adore the way you presented this. it's nice to see how people put different takes on the same cuisine you grew up with.  Your picture is so gorgeous!

comments.author: pb
comments.content:
HI there..very fancy presentation..chaat is mainly a north indian or bombay style thing, although in the US you mostly see it on Udupi menus.

When I was in the Bay area, esp san jose, sunnyvale etc., there was a 'chaat house' almost every block that served delicious chaat and other snacks. It was a pleasant surprise to see shops dedicated to chaat, since I was more accustomed to driving a 100 miles to even get to an Indian restaurant.( I lived in the american heartlands).

Thanks!
